intro: Cremolobus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cremolobus, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
